intro: Plagiogyria euphlebia var. grandis, commonly known as the large-flowered plagiogyria, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound umbels of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. It is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
